reviewText: The setting of this game is one that really piqued my interest, who would've thought that mining and tunneling in a post-apocalyptic European Union would be so immersive?\nThe main story behind the game, which the developers subtly drop clues and hints about, is that a group of individuals, cloned from the same template, are made to mine and tunnel for one of the many enclaves that emerged from the ruins of a nuclear war on a global scale, in a ragtag prequel to the famous metro" series.\nThe gameplay is very symbolic of how we are all trying to burrow ourselves into a little hole to escape the pressures of society. You don't just move rocks - you move hearts. The roar of the machines is the only motivation you need. They're there not just for manual support - they give more approval to you than your boss-bailiff
date: whom you never meet face-to-face. Your frustrations are almost literally blown away by the satisfaction of moving masses of earth
recommended: which is as simple as T...N...T.\nI was amazed at the concept of using gentically identical clones as manual labourers
hoursPlayed: and the subtle argument for its' establishment in the workplace portrayed by the game. While I disagree with oligopolistic conglomerates cloning its' own workforce
voteText: the game makes a convincing argument for the "pros" side of the argument.\n\nOh and P.S.
helpfulPercent: this game is boring. Really boring. You must detonate
votesTotal: and move gravel until your fingers
commentsCount: and brain bleed and you have the brain activity of a tomato. If you buy this game
column16: I will call Interpol and notify the international criminal court of your heinous act.\n\n(don't buy it pls)"

reviewText:
Terrible. I nearly aged another year by playing this game for a few minutes. It's incredibly dull and boring and cannot fathom as to why anyone would purposefully purchase this game. Still, I guess it's a decent attempt at simulating a tunnel boring process, for some obscure reason you may want that. I received this as part of a bundle, so please don't assume I bought it, I'd be embarrased.

I took me a few minutes to figure out exactly why I was provided with a utility van when I just wanted to blow something up. The game starts you off with in a utility van, you need to visit various marked off locations near the tunnel boring site in order to place TNT (which is invisible), it goes boom! then you have to shift a bunch of rocks (which glitch through the front-end loader), followed by a digging/boring process, followed by... ok, I didn't get that far.

Pro's:

1. If you like digging holes - this is for you. But bear in mind, they are predetermined craters.
2. If you are attracted to the notion of holding 'F' several times for seemingly no real reason, then this is for you
3. If you like driving poor handling utility vans and front-end loaders, then this is for you
4. It has explosions, but barely depictable, I had to take a few screenshots at the time to see if it actually was an explosion or just a bit of dust. Yes, it's just dust.

Con's:

1. Graphics are probably worse off than games produced in the late 1990's. Some serious low quality 2D texture stuff going on.
2. Frustrating gameplay
3. Poor physics, I'm not actually sure why they bothered with that.
4. Your brain might shutdown from boredom

Go spend your ten bucks somewhere else. Or just give it away altogether.

reviewText:
The game seems very bland and boring, with not a whole lot to do on top of a bad physics engine.

2/10 (May be some enjoyment out of messing around if you download a save for the other campaigns or something)

My experience with the game was clicking the only level available which is a tutorial, trying to drive the van to the locations, trying to lay down dynamite but it tipping over every turn. After finally placing them the tooltip said to pick up the rubble and throw into the designated area with the minimap showing the way there. I figured it meant take the rubble away from the area using the loader and dump truck but the loader takes too long to maneuvre, the camera makes it hard to see positioning and you can only carry a couple rocks from the ground into the loader at a time. As the loader was about half-full I guess back of the loader was caught on the front of the dump and it just sent both vehicles flying away from eachother. It just looked too tedious to continue and finish the job with I expect not much more to be added apart from monotomy...

reviewText:
Oh, oh...

I love simulations... Sim Ant, Sim World, Sim City, Sim Life etc.

I had luck, this game was in a bundle so it came quite cheap - but, if you look closer to this simulation you can see that it goes without the merits of the old time simulations that fans of the simulation genre fancy so much. It isn't as bad as some other simulations that were published over the past few years, but still it isn't a good simulation - it lacks the long term motivation thing, that kept us playing Sim City, the novelty of Sim Ant, and the complexity of Sim World and Sim Life.

I even have to ask myself, is this a Simulation" in the original sense of the meaning? I had to say: No. It is a "drive around a site of civil engineering and mining and try out the construction site equipment. I like building machinery
date: I like tractors - mostly because I grew up on a rural town
recommended: were you had those things as "toys" to play around.\n\nThus the game fails the descriptor - "Simulation"
hoursPlayed: at least in the most obvious ways.\n\nAnd then
voteText: is a game that simulates day to day routines of a "everyday"-job a good thing to simulate? Do you want to be a construction site worker for real (I have been for three years after grammar-school)
votesHelpful: a farmer or forester? And to what extend do you wish to "simulate" the job?\n\nIf you answer any of this three questions with a denial
votesTotal: this game clearly isn't for you. If you answer just two of those with a no
votesFunny: or say you don't like simplifications on sims - be wary of this game. If you answer all those with yes
commentsCount: or say that you want a casual
column16: simplified sim - you might have a hit here; there are no calculations of quantities required
column17: no structural engineering calculations and no insurances for your workers... so much for the Sim Part of the game ;-)\n\nSince the user base is very limited
column18: I won't recomend the game - though I sometimes might enjoy that kind of "simplification"..."

reviewText:
Expect to be mining and tunneling... If you don't like the idea, don't play this. Easy right?

Is it good game? Not in the common sense
Is it good simulator? HELL YES
Is it worth 10 bucks? Nope, but in bundle or a discount, it is good buy
Would I play this for an hour a day? No way, I'd rather take up knitting
Would I dig another tunnel? Yes, I think I would.

There are some minor technical issues like wrong texture clipping when frantically moving the camera inside the tunnel or when driving trucks close to some objects, but nothing critical.

Tunnel creation stages

1) Strip mining the entrance
Driving in the van and setting up dynamites. Driving model is just HORRIBLE. It does not take too long, so its bearable. But hey, it's not a van driving simulator, right?

2) Cleaning up the debris
With an excavator you must load stones onto a truck and then drive with them to dump them. This part actually is not one big 'Physics, what physics?' mess and it's fun to do. Also kinda frustrating, because the rocks are not very cooperative. And again, it does not take very long, just about the right time to do the work

3) Digging the tunnel
Last part which is both the most interesting and the most frustrating. From a control room you control the TBM that diggs the tunel. The controlling part of the TBM is complex and requires some practice. Thats the interesting part.
But you have to supply the TBM with concrete. Loading the blocks onto a train was difficult at first and was fun to learn it. But then I find out A LOT of LOTS of concrete. For a tunnel of 6 kms you need to load like 7 FULL trains. First train was to learn, second to practice, third to try some cool moves... Fourth started to be tedious.... For a tunnel of length 89 kilometers, I'd have to break something. So how'bout nope....
